page.title: 11RELIGIONS & ATTITUDES,SLOUGH
page.content:
430 pupils aged 12-18 in a co-ed school were used as a sample population. They were asked about their religions and their attitudes. The following results were obtained:
{Religious 216 }|{ Christian 96 {Non-religious 183 }|{ Muslims 50 {No answer 31 }|{ Hindus 28 { }|{ Buddhists 8 { }|{ Jews 1 { }|{ Sikhs 33
Questions asked about abuse for religious beliefs raised interesting answers. 22% of students have known some physical or verbal abuse. The feeling was that Christians did not generally suffer abuse. Sikhs felt very harassed - mainly because of recent events in India. Most abuse was aimed at appearance and food beliefs.
